headline.print_headline: Poland, Cautiously, Says It Would Welcome Russian Cash
headline.main: Poland Trying to Build Banks' Defenses

docs.snippet: Poland says it is open to foreign direct investment from any source but might balk at the acqusition of domestic banks by a Russian lender....
docs.abstract: Polish authorities announce that they are open to an inflow of Russian capital, even as they pursue a strategy of bolstering Polish banks against Russian takeovers; some Poles, harboring Soviet-era resentment, oppose the idea of Russian takeovers, and are pushing for regulations to prevent them.
docs.lead_paragraph: Poland says it is open to foreign direct investment from any source but might balk at the acqusition of domestic banks by a Russian lender.

headline.print_headline: Russia’s Biggest Bank Shops in Former Soviet Bloc
headline.seo: Sberbank Looks to Buy Banks in Eastern Europe
headline.main: Russian Lender Building Its Own Bloc in Eastern Europe

docs.snippet: An acquisition campaign that expands Sberbank in eight Eastern European countries might seem like a banker’s version of rebuilding the old Soviet bloc....
docs.lead_paragraph: An acquisition campaign that expands Sberbank in eight Eastern European countries might seem like a banker’s version of rebuilding the old Soviet bloc.

headline.seo: Ford Tries to Save the Lincoln
headline.main: Ford Tries to Save the Lincoln Brand

docs.snippet: Sales of Ford’s luxury nameplate peaked in 1990 at more than 200,000 vehicles, but by last year only 85,643 were sold....

keywords.value: Lincoln Division of Ford Motor Co
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column analyzes Ford Motor's prospects for saving its faltering Lincoln brand of luxury cars; notes that Ford has put the brand's future into the hands of young designer Max Wolff, who envisions a radical return to Lincoln's long-lost position as an innovator of style.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sales of Ford’s luxury nameplate peaked in 1990 at more than 200,000 vehicles, but by last year only 85,643 were sold.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Danish court on Friday began the trial of four Swedish men accused of plotting a shooting spree in revenge for controversial cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad in 2005.

headline.print_headline: Obama, Like Buffett, Had Lower Tax Rate Than His Secretary
headline.main: Obama, Like Buffett, Had Lower Tax Rate Than His Secretary

docs.snippet: President Obama has cited the fact that the billionaire investor Warren E. Buffett pays less of his income in taxes than his secretary as an egregious example of an unjust tax code....
docs.abstract: Pres Obama's tax returns show that he and wife Michelle paid just over 20 percent of their gross income in federal taxes, a rate slightly lower than that of Obama's secretary Anita Decker Breckenridge; Obama has cited the fact that billionaire Warren E Buffet pays a lower tax rate than his secretary as an egregious example of an unjust tax code.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has cited the fact that the billionaire investor Warren E. Buffett pays less of his income in taxes than his secretary as an egregious example of an unjust tax code.

headline.print_headline: After Saving Woman From Fire, A Mayor Recalls His Fear and Focus
headline.seo: Mayor Cory Booker Says He Felt Terror in Fire Rescue
headline.main: After Rescuing Woman From Fire, a Mayor Recalls His Fear and Focus

docs.snippet: Mayor Cory A. Booker, who saved a woman from her burning house, said that “there was a time when I didn’t think we’d make it out of there.”...
docs.abstract: Newark, NJ, Mayor Cory A Booker holds press conference to answer questions about his experience rescuing a neighbor from her burning home.

byline.contributor: David W. Chen, Christopher Reeve and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Cory A. Booker, who saved a woman from her burning house, said that “there was a time when I didn’t think we’d make it out of there.”
